harmonization.seo.title: Image harmonization · Voxel
harmonization.seo.description: Harmonize the colors of an image by reducing the color palette
harmonization.title: Harmonization
harmonization.description: This tool allows you to harmonize a texture by extracting its colors and quantifying the image to reduce the palette.
harmonization.small: For example, you can use this tool to improve the result of a texture generated by a generative model.
harmonization.drop: Drop your image here or click to select
studio.maintenance.title: Maintenance
studio.maintenance.description: We are currently performing maintenance on the server. Please check back later.
studio.title: Voxel Studio
studio.description: A tool to modify DATAPACKS content with the simplest and most intuitive interface that requires no development knowledge.
studio.error.invalid_file: Invalid file type. Please use .zip or .jar
studio.error.failed_to_download_reposito: Failed to download repository from GitHub
studio.error.no_elements: The datapack is empty or contains no supported elements
studio.upload.description: Drop your datapack or mod (.zip or .jar) here to start configuring
studio.questions.values.0.question: What is this tool for?
studio.questions.values.0.answer: This tool is designed to modify enchantments of existing content, such as NeoEnchant+, Dungeons & Taverns, or any other pack, with the simplest and most intuitive interface that requires no development knowledge.
studio.questions.values.1.question: Minecraft Java Edition or Bedrock Edition?
studio.questions.values.1.answer: This tool is designed for Minecraft Java Edition. Bedrock Edition is not supported.
studio.questions.values.2.question: How do I get started?
studio.questions.values.2.answer: Simply drop existing content into the gray area. You can also modify Minecraft's base content using the white button.
studio.questions.values.3.question: Mods or Datapacks?
studio.questions.values.3.answer: This tool is designed to support both datapacks and mods (Forge, Fabric, NeoForge, Quilt).
studio.questions.values.4.question: How do I download the modified content?
studio.questions.values.4.answer: When you are in the configuration interface, in the bottom left, you will find a white download button.
studio.questions.values.5.question: If the content gets updated, will I have to redo everything?
studio.questions.values.5.answer: If you want to update your configuration to a different version of the original work, there is a migration tool available.
converter.seo.title: Datapack/Mods Converter · Voxel
converter.seo.description: Convert your datapacks to Forge, Fabric, Quilt, and NeoForge mods easily with our online tool.
converter.description: This tool allows you to easily convert your Minecraft datapacks into mods for different platforms: Forge, Fabric, Quilt, and NeoForge. Simply drop your ZIP file and choose the target platforms.
converter.instruction: Drop your datapack ZIP file here.
converter.dropzone: Drop your datapack in the ZIP format here
converter.description_list.1: Drop your datapack ZIP file here.
converter.description_list.2: The .jar file will be automatically downloaded in your browser, you can use it in your Minecraft game on any platform. (Forge, Fabric, Quilt, NeoForge)
converter.step1.title: Drop your datapack ZIP file
converter.step1.description: Drop your datapack ZIP file here, it will be analyzed and converted automatically.
converter.step2.title: The download starts automatically
converter.step2.description: The .jar file will be automatically downloaded and usable on all platforms. (Forge, Fabric, Quilt, NeoForge)
converter.form.name: Name
converter.form.advanced_description: This information will be displayed in the mod listing on Modrinth/CurseForge and in the mod menu of Minecraft.
converter.form.authors_placeholder: Type and press Enter to add
migration.seo.title: Datapack Migration · Voxel
migration.seo.description: Migrate your mods or datapacks, modified by the configurator, to a different version, while keeping your modifications active.
migration.home_description: Migrate your mods or datapacks, modified by the configurator, to a different version, while keeping your modifications active.
migration.source: Your datapack customized by the configurator
migration.target: The datapack you want to update
migration.drop.source: Drop your datapack customized by the configurator in this box
migration.drop.target: Drop the datapack you want to update in this box
migration.error_types.invalid_datapack: This content is not a datapack modified by the configurator
migration.error_types.no_logs: No migration file found in the content
migration.success_info.additional_info: Quick tip: You can rename any mod or datapack - it won't affect anything!
migration.about.text: This tool lets you migrate from a datapack/mod you've customized with the configurator to another version of the same project, keeping your modifications active on the latest version.
migration.about.list.first: You can migrate to any version, whether it's new or old.
migration.about.list.second: You can migrate from a datapack to mods, or vice versa.
migration.about.list.third: It works with any mods or datapack.
migration.about.title: Explore our datapacks
migration.about.description: On Modrinth, find all our datapacks, like NeoEnchant which adds enchantments, Yggdrasil which adds a nordic story with tons of structures!
migration.step1.title: Drop your datapack modified by the configurator
migration.step1.description: Drop the datapack you modified with the configurator here, it'll be automatically analyzed and migrated.
migration.step2.title: Drop the datapack you want to update
migration.step2.description: Drop the datapack you want to migrate to here, and the configuration will be automatically applied from the pack you dropped on the left.
migration.step3.title: Migration complete
migration.step3.description: Once the migration is complete, the datapack will automatically download in your browser
harmonization.no_image_selected_descript: Upload an image from your device or select one from the gallery to start harmonizing colors.
footer.description: VOXEL, what is it? These are guides in French, from beginner to advanced level, to learn how to develop mods or enrich your existing knowledge.

suggestions.studio.description: Discover the voxel configurator to personalize your game experience. It works with any packs, but also with any mods.

supports.title: Supports Voxel
supports.description: These tools are free. I have tons of ideas for the Minecraft community but I lack funding to do advanced things. If you like what I do, become a Patreon and you will even get exclusive benefits.

effects:minecraft:ammo_use: Amount of ammunition used when firing a bow or crossbow.
effects:minecraft:armor_effectiveness: Effectiveness of the target's armor during an attack. 0 means completely ineffective; 1 means fully effective.
effects:minecraft:attributes: Modifies player statistics when the weapon is equipped or held.
effects:minecraft:block_experience: Performs a mathematical operation on the experience gained from breaking a block.
effects:minecraft:crossbow_charge_time: Time required to fully charge the crossbow.
effects:minecraft:crossbow_charging_soun: Plays a sound when the crossbow is fully charged.
effects:minecraft:damage: Amount of damage dealt by an attack.
effects:minecraft:damage_immunity: Grants immunity to damage under certain conditions.
effects:minecraft:damage_protection: Reduces the amount of damage received from attacks.
effects:minecraft:equipment_drops: Chance of equipment dropping from a killed entity. Value ranges from 0 to 1.
effects:minecraft:fishing_luck_bonus: Increases the player's luck when fishing.
effects:minecraft:fishing_time_reduction: Reduces the time it takes to catch a fish.
effects:minecraft:hit_block: Triggers an action when the player or a projectile hits a block.
effects:minecraft:item_damage: Amount of durability lost when an item is damaged.
effects:minecraft:knockback: Amount of knockback caused by an attack.
effects:minecraft:location_changed: Triggers an action when the player changes location.
effects:minecraft:mob_experience: Performs a mathematical operation on the experience gained from killing a mob.
effects:minecraft:post_attack: Triggers an action after an attack.
effects:minecraft:prevent_armor_change: Prevents the player from unequipping armor.
effects:minecraft:prevent_equipment_drop: Prevents the item from dropping when the player dies.
effects:minecraft:projectile_count: Increases the number of projectiles fired.
effects:minecraft:projectile_piercing: Changes the number of entities a projectile can pierce.
effects:minecraft:projectile_spawned: Triggers an action when a projectile is spawned.
effects:minecraft:projectile_spread: Alters the spread distance between projectiles.
effects:minecraft:repair_with_xp: Performs a mathematical operation on the weapon's durability when experience is gained.
effects:minecraft:smash_damage_per_falle: Performs a mathematical operation on damage based on the number of blocks fallen.
effects:minecraft:tick: Triggers an action on every game tick.
effects:minecraft:trident_return_acceler: Changes the speed at which a trident returns to the player.
effects:minecraft:trident_sound: Plays a sound when the trident is thrown.
effects:minecraft:trident_spin_attack_st: Modifies the strength of the trident's spin attack.
enchantment:overview.dialog.welcome.body: This page lets you manage the pack's enchantments. You can add, edit, and delete enchantments.
enchantment:overview.dialog.welcome.list: You can disable an enchantment using the purple button at the top right of the enchantment.
Access the configurator with the bottom button.
enchantment:overview.dialog.toolbar.body: At the bottom of Voxel, you'll find the toolbar. It lets you search, sort, and change the view of enchantments.
enchantment:overview.dialog.toolbar.list: Quickly find the enchantment you're looking for.
Easily view and sort important information.
enchantment:overview.dialog.advanced.bod: When in grouped view, you can drag and drop enchantments from one group to another to quickly modify them.
enchantment:overview.dialog.advanced.lis: drag to another group to assign it the same exclusive set.
drag to another group to assign it the same supported items.
drag to another group to assign it the same activation slot.
enchantment:overview.title: Enchantments
enchantment:overview.description: Manage the pack's enchantments. You can add, edit, and delete enchantments.
enchantment:overview.sort.slots.label: Slots
enchantment:overview.sort.none.label: View All
enchantment:overview.sort.slots.descript: Group by slots (when the effect activates)
enchantment:overview.sort.supported.sect: Enchantments are grouped by their supported items.
enchantment:overview.sort.exclusive.sect: Enchantments are grouped by their exclusive sets (non-combinable).
enchantment:overview.sort.slots.section: Enchantments are grouped by their activation slots.
enchantment:overview.enchanting_table: This enchantment can be found on an enchanting table
enchantment:overview.chest: This enchantment can be found in chests
enchantment:overview.tradeable: This enchantment can be traded by villagers like a book
enchantment:overview.tradeable_equipment: This enchantment can be traded by villagers like an item
enchantment:overview.price_doubled: The price of the trade is doubled
enchantment:overview.sort.none.section: These enchantments do not match any sorting criteria.
enchantment:section.slots.description: When the enchantment effect should be activated.
enchantment:section.supported.descriptio: Which items are compatible with this enchantment.
enchantment:global.maxLevel.title: Maximum level
enchantment:global.maxLevel.description: The maximum level of the enchantment.
enchantment:global.weight.title: Weight
enchantment:global.weight.description: The rarity of the enchantment in the enchantment table.
enchantment:global.anvilCost.title: Anvil cost
enchantment:global.anvilCost.description: The cost of combining two items with this enchantment.
enchantment:global.minCostBase.title: Minimum base cost
enchantment:global.minCostPerLevelAboveF: Minimum cost per level above the first
enchantment:global.maxCostBase.title: Maximum base cost
enchantment:global.maxCostPerLevelAboveF: Maximum cost per level above the first
enchantment:global.mode.title: Mode
enchantment:global.mode.description: Choose between Normal (default), Soft Delete (Deactivates effects and obtaining) or Only Creative (Obtained only in creative).
enchantment:global.explanation.title: Detailed explanations of the different components
enchantment:global.explanation.list.1: Sets the maximum level of the enchantment, the effect values automatically adapt to the levels.
enchantment:global.explanation.list.2: The higher this value is, the more often the enchantment will appear in the enchanting table.
enchantment:global.explanation.list.3: The cost to apply this enchantment to another item using an anvil. Divided by two if using a book, multiplied by the enchantment level.

enchantment:find.enchanting_table.title: Enchanting Table
enchantment:find.enchanting_table.descri: This enchantment can be obtained from the enchanting table.
enchantment:find.mob_equipment.title: Mob Equipment
enchantment:find.mob_equipment.descripti: This enchantment can be found on mob equipment.
enchantment:find.loot_in_chests.title: Loot in Chests
enchantment:find.loot_in_chests.descript: This enchantment can be found on naturally generated equipment in chests or other rewards.
enchantment:find.tradeable.title: Tradeable
enchantment:find.tradeable.description: This enchantment can be sold by villagers as an enchanted book.
enchantment:find.tradeable_equipment.des: This enchantment can be sold by villagers on equipment.
enchantment:find.curse.title: Curse
enchantment:find.curse.description: This enchantment will have a red description and cannot be removed with a grindstone
enchantment:find.non_treasure.title: Non-treasure
enchantment:find.non_treasure.descriptio: Used in loot tables like fishing junk, certain structures, etc.
enchantment:find.treasure.title: Treasure
enchantment:find.treasure.description: Used in loot tables like fishing rewards.
enchantment:technical.price_doubled.desc: This enchantment is charged twice as much in villager trades.
enchantment:technical.smelts_loot.title: Smelts loot
enchantment:technical.smelts_loot.descri: Items dropped by mobs will be smelted.
enchantment:technical.prevent_bee_spawni: Prevent bees from spawning when breaking hive
The hive will not spawn bees when broken, and bees will be included in the block data.
enchantment:technical.prevent_pot_shatte: Decorated pots will not break when broken with a tool or projectile.
enchantment:technical.prevent_ice_meltin: Ice will not turn into water when broken
enchantment:technical.prevent_infested_b: Infested blocks will not spawn silverfish.
enchantment:technical.effects.title: Enchantment effects
enchantment:exclusive.custom.fallback: Does not contain any custom enchantment lists.
enchantment:exclusive.set.armor.title: Armor Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.armor.descript: Contains all exclusive enchantments for armor.
enchantment:exclusive.set.bow.title: Bow Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.bow.descriptio: Contains all exclusive enchantments for bows.
enchantment:exclusive.set.crossbow.title: Crossbow Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.crossbow.descr: Contains all exclusive enchantments for crossbows.
enchantment:exclusive.set.damage.title: Damage Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.damage.descrip: Contains all exclusive enchantments for damage.
enchantment:exclusive.set.mining.title: Mining Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.mining.descrip: Contains all exclusive enchantments for mining.
enchantment:exclusive.set.riptide.title: Riptide Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.riptide.descri: Contains all exclusive enchantments for Riptide.
enchantment:exclusive.set.boots.title: Boots Set
enchantment:exclusive.set.boots.descript: Contains all exclusive enchantments for boots.
enchantment:exclusive.vanilla.title: Vanilla
enchantment:exclusive.custom.title: Custom
enchantment:exclusive.dialog.explain.tar: Targeting a group makes the current enchantment incompatible with all enchantments in that list.
enchantment:exclusive.dialog.explain.mem: Being part of a group lists this enchantment so that every other enchantment targeting the group can see it.
enchantment:exclusive.dialog.members.emp: No enchantments are listed in this group yet.
enchantment:exclusive.actions.target.des: Makes the enchantment target the tags list, making it incompatible with all enchantments in that list.
enchantment:exclusive.actions.membership: Adds this enchantment to the tags list
enchantment:toggle.supported.title: Supported
enchantment:toggle.supported.description: Items on which this enchantment can be applied, including anvil, /enchant command, or in reward.
enchantment:toggle.primary.title: Enchanting Table
enchantment:toggle.primary.description: Items for which this enchantment appears in an enchanting table. If set to 'Default', equals the option chosen in 'Supported'.
enchantment:toggle.group.title: Predefined Group
enchantment:toggle.group.description: 'Predefined Groups' are lists of enchantments that don't combine together. These are great if you're using other mods or datapacks since they can add their own enchantments to these lists too.
enchantment:toggle.individual.title: Arbitrary Choice
enchantment:toggle.individual.descriptio: 'Arbitrary Choice' lets you choose exactly which enchantments shouldn't combine together, one by one.
enchantment:slots.mainhand.title: Main Hand
enchantment:slots.mainhand.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the main hand.
enchantment:slots.offhand.title: Off Hand
enchantment:slots.offhand.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the offhand.
enchantment:slots.head.title: Head
enchantment:slots.head.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the head.
enchantment:slots.chest.title: Chest
enchantment:slots.chest.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the chest.
enchantment:slots.legs.title: Legs
enchantment:slots.legs.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the legs.
enchantment:slots.feet.title: Feet
enchantment:slots.feet.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the feet.
enchantment:slots.body.title: Body (Dog - Horse)
enchantment:slots.body.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped on the body of a dog or horse.
enchantment:slots.saddle.title: Saddle
enchantment:slots.saddle.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped on the saddle.
enchantment:slots.armor.title: Armor
enchantment:slots.armor.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped on any armor piece.
enchantment:slots.any.title: Any
enchantment:slots.any.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped on any piece.
enchantment:slots.hand.title: Hand
enchantment:slots.hand.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the hand.
enchantment:slots.hands.title: Hands
enchantment:slots.hands.description: The effects will be activated when the item is equipped in the hands.
enchantment:slots.explanation.title: Here's how enchantment slots work and when their effects kick in:
enchantment:slots.explanation.list.1: Take Fire Aspect for example - if you put it on your main hand or offhand weapon, it'll set enemies on fire when you hit them.
enchantment:slots.explanation.list.2: And if you put Fire Aspect on any armor piece (head, chest, legs or feet) and you equip it, it'll light up enemies every time you attack.
enchantment:simulation.title: Enchantment Table Simulation
enchantment:simulation.description: Simulate enchanting mechanics and probability outcomes
enchantment:simulation.enchant_sublabel: Select a slot to run simulation
enchantment:simulation.enchantability.de: Automatically set based on the item, used in the simulation.
enchantment:simulation.vanilla.title: Vanilla Enchantments
enchantment:simulation.vanilla.descripti: Include default Minecraft enchantments in simulation
enchantment:simulation.tooltip.title: Show Tooltip
enchantment:simulation.tooltip.descripti: When enabled, the tooltip will be shown on the item permanently.
enchantment:simulation.iterations.label: Iterations
enchantment:simulation.results.title: Probability Results
enchantment:simulation.results.descripti: Calculated based on the number of iterations, one iteration is one attempt to enchant the item
The total probability does not add up to 100%, as multiple enchantments can be applied to a single item
enchantment:simulation.results.empty.des: Click on one of the three slots to see probability results
enchantment:simulation.dialog.usage.titl: How to Use the Enchantment Simulation
enchantment:simulation.dialog.usage.body: This tool simulates the enchanting table mechanics to help you balance your datapack enchantments.
enchantment:simulation.dialog.usage.list: Set the three parameters: bookshelf count, enchantability, and iterations.
Click on one of the three enchantment options to run the simulation.
Higher iterations take longer but provide more accurate results.
enchantment:simulation.dialog.stats.body: The results table shows probability statistics based on your simulation parameters.
enchantment:simulation.dialog.stats.list: Each enchantment's appearance probability is calculated.
Average levels and level ranges are displayed.
Results consider weight, max_level, costs, enchantability, bookshelf count, tiers, and enchantment incompatibilities (Exclusive Set / Non Combinable).
enchantment:simulation.dialog.results.bo: This shows the results of a single enchantment attempt, unlike the grouped large-scale statistics.
enchantment:simulation.dialog.results.li: Click the book icon to permanently display single iteration results on items.
Otherwise, hover over items to see their enchantments from the single iteration.
enchantment:simulation.dialog.item_selec: You can change the item being enchanted to test different scenarios.
Click on the item slot to open the Dynamic Toolbar item selector.
Select and validate your choice. The enchantability value updates automatically.
Available items are calculated from enchantments, so only enchantable items are displayed.

studio:dialog.home.title: Welcome to the Pack Editor!
studio:dialog.home.body: Voxel Studio is designed for everyone. No coding or development knowledge required. Simply edit existing game content to create your perfect experience.
studio:dialog.home.list.1: Intuitive interface accessible to all players.
studio:dialog.home.list.2: Modify vanilla content without writing code.
studio:dialog.overview.title: Overview Pages
studio:dialog.overview.body: Overview pages let you browse and navigate between elements quickly. Switch from one element to another with ease across all concepts.
studio:dialog.overview.list.1: Grid and list views to suit your preference.
studio:dialog.overview.list.2: Search bar to quickly find any element.
studio:dialog.overview.list.3: Quick options to filter and sort content.
studio:dialog.edit.title: Configure Elements
studio:dialog.edit.body: Click 'Configure' from any overview to access detailed editing pages. Adjust game design, tweak balance, or disable elements entirely.
studio:dialog.edit.list.1: Fine-tune game balance with intuitive controls.
studio:dialog.edit.list.2: Easily enable or disable specific elements.
studio:dialog.simulation.title: Simulation Mode
studio:dialog.simulation.body: Some concepts offer simulation to preview how changes will look in-game. Get relevant stats and information in a clear, accessible format.
studio:dialog.simulation.list.1: Preview your changes as they would appear in Minecraft.
studio:dialog.debug.title: Debug Mode
studio:dialog.debug.body: Enable debug mode in settings to access advanced information. Inspect file contents before and after modifications for full transparency.
studio:dialog.debug.list.1: View raw file data and structure.
studio:dialog.export.title: Export Your Work
studio:dialog.export.body: Export your creations in multiple formats. Studio handles the conversion from datapack to mod automatically.
studio:dialog.export.list.1: Export as .zip datapack for vanilla Minecraft.
studio:dialog.export.list.2: Export as .jar mod ready for mod loaders.
studio:dialog.export.list.3: GitHub integration for push and pull requests.
